articles.headline: Connecticut Bank Is Drawn Into Madoff Scandal
articles.snippet: Lawyers in Florida say they are investigating the role that a Connecticut bank may have played in steering money to Bernard L. Madoff.
articles.abstract: Lawyers in Florida say they are investigating the role that a Connecticut bank may have played in steering money to Bernard L. Madoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawyers in Florida say they are investigating the role that a Connecticut bank may have played in steering money to Bernard L. Madoff, the Wall Street trader accused of operating a $50 billion Ponzi scheme.

articles.headline: In Dense Gaza, Civilians Suffer
articles.snippet: Despite the precision of the strikes, Israel’s missiles have splintered families and shattered homes in one of the most densely populated areas on Earth.
articles.abstract: Despite the precision of the strikes, Israel’s missiles have splintered families and shattered homes in one of the most densely populated areas on Earth.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA  A dentist stood at the bed of a doctor, his good friend Ehab Madhoun, 32, who had just died, his shrapnel-pitted body wrapped in a white shroud.

articles.headline: Citigroup’s Top Executives to Forgo ’08 Bonuses
articles.snippet: The decision from Vikram S. Pandit, Citigroup’s chief executive, and Winfried F. W. Bischoff, the bank’s chairman, stands as a test of whether high pay is necessary to retain talented executives.
articles.abstract: The decision from Vikram S. Pandit, Citigroup’s chief executive, and Winfried F. W. Bischoff, the bank’s chairman, stands as a test of whether high pay is necessary to retain talented executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wall Street is hitting its bankers where it hurts  in the wallet.
articles.byline: By Eric Dash and Louise Story
